problem_list.display: Type 2 diabetes mellitus with chronic kidney disease

medications.sig_text: Take 500mg by mouth twice daily with meals
medications.clinician_notes: Monitor kidney function. Hold if eGFR drops below 30.
medications.interaction_notes: Hold 48 hours before and after CT scan with contrast dye.

medications.sig_text: Take as directed based on INR results
medications.clinician_notes: Target INR 2.0-3.0 for AFib. Weekly INR checks required.
medications.interaction_notes: Avoid NSAIDs (ibuprofen, aspirin). Keep vitamin K intake consistent - don't suddenly increase or decrease leafy greens.

medications.timing: morning and early afternoon, not after 4pm
medications.clinician_notes: For heart failure fluid management. Weigh daily.
medications.interaction_notes: Can cause low potassium. Take potassium supplement as prescribed.

medications.sig_text: Take 20mEq by mouth daily with food
medications.clinician_notes: To replace potassium lost from Lasix.
medications.interaction_notes: Take with food to avoid stomach upset. Do not crush tablets.

medications.sig_text: Take 12.5mg by mouth twice daily with food
medications.clinician_notes: Beta-blocker for heart failure and heart rate control.
medications.interaction_notes: May cause dizziness. Rise slowly from sitting or lying down. Do not stop suddenly.

medications.clinician_notes: ACE inhibitor for heart and kidney protection.
medications.interaction_notes: May cause dry cough. Can raise potassium levels - monitored with blood tests.

medications.sig_text: Take 75mcg by mouth daily on empty stomach
medications.timing: first thing in morning, 60 minutes before food or other medicines
medications.clinician_notes: For hypothyroidism. Take on empty stomach.
medications.interaction_notes: Separate from calcium, iron, and antacids by at least 4 hours - they block absorption.

medications.sig_text: Take 650mg by mouth every 6 hours as needed for pain
medications.clinician_notes: Preferred pain reliever - safe with warfarin.
medications.interaction_notes: Do NOT exceed 3000mg per day. Do NOT take ibuprofen, naproxen, or aspirin - dangerous with warfarin.

results.source_note: Above target range - warfarin dose may need adjustment
Above goal - discuss at next visit
Elevated - watch for fluid buildup symptoms
Thyroid well controlled on current dose

care_gaps.item_text: INR recheck needed - last result was high
care_gaps.next_step: Call clinic to schedule INR blood draw

care_gaps.item_text: Diabetic eye exam overdue by 8 months

care_gaps.next_step: Ask pharmacy about flu shot availability

care_gaps.item_text: Daily weight check for fluid monitoring
care_gaps.next_step: Weigh daily - call if gain more than 3 lbs in a day or 5 lbs in a week
Call heart doctor's office to schedule 3-month check
